member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.ApplicationXJavascript
member.summary: Used to denote the encoding necessary for files containing JavaScript source code. The alternative MIME type for this file type is text/javascript.

member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.AudioL24
member.summary: 24bit Linear PCM audio at 8-48kHz, 1-N channels; Defined in RFC 3190

member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.ApplicationXShockwaveFlash
member.summary: Adobe Flash files for example with the extension .swf

member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.ApplicationOctetStream
member.summary: Arbitrary binary data.[5] Generally speaking this type identifies files that are not associated with a specific application. Contrary to past assumptions by software packages such as Apache this is not a type that should be applied to unknown files. In such a case, a server or application should not indicate a content type, as it may be incorrect, but rather, should omit the type in order to allow the recipient to guess the type.[6]

member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.TextCss
member.summary: Cascading Style Sheets; Defined in RFC 2318

member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.TextCmd
member.summary: commands; subtype resident in Gecko browsers like Firefox 3.5

member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.ApplicationXDeb
member.summary: deb (file format), a software package format used by the Debian project

member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.ApplicationEcmascript
member.summary: ECMAScript/JavaScript; Defined in RFC 4329 (equivalent to application/javascript but with stricter processing rules)

member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.ApplicationEdifact
member.summary: EDI EDIFACT data; Defined in RFC 1767

member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.ApplicationEdiX12
member.summary: EDI X12 data; Defined in RFC 1767

member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.MessagePartial
member.summary: Email; Defined in RFC 2045 and RFC 2046

member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.MessageRfc822
member.summary: Email; EML files, MIME files, MHT files, MHTML files; Defined in RFC 2045 and RFC 2046

member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.TextXml
member.summary: Extensible Markup Language; Defined in RFC 3023

member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.ImageGif
member.summary: GIF image; Defined in RFC 2045 and RFC 2046

member.summary: IGS files, IGES files; Defined in RFC 2077

member.summary: IMDN Instant Message Disposition Notification; Defined in RFC 5438

member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.ApplicationJson
member.summary: JavaScript Object Notation JSON; Defined in RFC 4627

member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.ApplicationJsonPatch
member.summary: JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) Patch; Defined in RFC 6902

member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.ImagePjpeg
member.summary: JPEG JFIF image; Associated with Internet Explorer; Listed in ms775147(v=vs.85) - Progressive JPEG, initiated before global browser support for progressive JPEGs (Microsoft and Firefox).

member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.ImageJpeg
member.summary: JPEG JFIF image; Defined in RFC 2045 and RFC 2046

member.summary: MIME Email; Defined in RFC 2045 and RFC 2046

member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.MultipartMixed
member.summary: MIME Email; Defined in RFC 2045 and RFC 2046

member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.MultipartRelated
member.summary: MIME Email; Defined in RFC 2387 and used by MHTML (HTML mail)

member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.AudioMpeg
member.summary: MP3 or other MPEG audio; Defined in RFC 3003

member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.VideoMpeg
member.summary: MPEG-1 video with multiplexed audio; Defined in RFC 2045 and RFC 2046

member.summary: MSH files, MESH files; Defined in RFC 2077, SILO files

member.summary: mulaw audio at 8 kHz, 1 channel; Defined in RFC 2046

member.summary: Ogg Theora or other video (with audio); Defined in RFC 5334

member.summary: Ogg Vorbis, Speex, Flac and other audio; Defined in RFC 5334

member.name: F:IF.Net.MimeTypes.MimeTypeNames.ApplicationOgg
member.summary: Ogg, a multimedia bitstream container format; Defined in RFC 5334

member.summary: Portable Document Format, PDF has been in use for document exchange on the Internet since 1993; Defined in RFC 3778

member.summary: Portable Network Graphics; Registered,[8] Defined in RFC 2083
